question: Question_03_(a)
statement:
Consider the discrete dynamical system

$\begin{bmatrix} a_{n+1} \\ b_{n+1} \\ c_{n+1} \end{bmatrix} = \frac{1}{6} \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 3 & 2 \\ 2 & 1 & 1 \\ 3 & 2 & 3 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} a_{n} \\ b_{n} \\ c_{n} \end{bmatrix}$

which describes the evolution of the vector
$\begin{bmatrix} a & b & c \end{bmatrix}^{T}$

Explain what a Markov matrix (stochastic matrix) is and why the
coefficient matrix of this discrete dynamical system is a Markov matrix.
sols:
A stochastic matrix \emph{P} is a matrix in which

a) all entries of \emph{P} are non negative

b) all columns of \emph{P} add to one

The given matrix satisfies these conditions hence is a Markov matrix.
